intro: Neokoehleria penduliflora, commonly known as the hanging flower plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its pendulous inflorescences that bear clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are adapted for pollination by birds and insects, and it thrives in well-drained soil with partial to full sunlight. Neokoehleria penduliflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
